page.title: 12Staffordshire C/C Election
page.content: Hollinsclough School is a Polling Station. A few days before the Election two polling booths arrived, both were wooden 185m high by 65 cms wide. Inside a little shelf on which you rest your paper when you vote, a pencil is provided. You mark your vote on a ballot paper. On May 2nd the children had a holiday but four of us volunteered to come and interview people, these included the candidates - Eileen Critchlow and Malcolm Ward, the Policeman-P.C. Potts and the voters. Mrs. Bowers, the Polling Clerk,ticked the voters name off the register of electors, Mr. Bowers, Polling Officer, gave the voters their ballot paper.The votes are placed in a wooden black box. It is sealed with sealing wax and then taken to Leek for the votes to be counted.Michelle Grindy Age 10
